Uses of Class
rationale.emotions.pojo.Location

  • Packages that use Location 
    Package Description
    rationale.emotions
    This package contains the representation of chess-board along with a manager utility to help move chess pawns on the board in an attempt to find a resolution.
    rationale.emotions.chesspawn
    This package contains the interface definitions that defines the abilities of any given chess pawn.
    rationale.emotions.chesspawn.impl
    This package houses the actual pawns that would be used on a Chess board.
    rationale.emotions.pojo
    This package houses all of the POJOs (Plain Old Java Objects) that are used by this application.

    • Uses of Location in rationale.emotions

      Methods in rationale.emotions that return Location 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Location ChessBoard.getFinalLocation() 
      Methods in rationale.emotions that return types with arguments of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static List<Location> PawnMoveManager.lookForSolution(Location location, IPawn pawn, ChessBoard board)
      This utility method attempts at trying to find the shortest path from the location represented by Location to the location represented by ChessBoard.getFinalLocation().
      Methods in rationale.emotions with parameters of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean ChessBoard.canVisit(Location location)
      Helps determine if a Given a Location object can be visited or not.
      boolean ChessBoard.isValid(Location location) 
      static List<Location> PawnMoveManager.lookForSolution(Location location, IPawn pawn, ChessBoard board)
      This utility method attempts at trying to find the shortest path from the location represented by Location to the location represented by ChessBoard.getFinalLocation().
      void ChessBoard.markAsNotVisited(Location location)
      Given a Location object, the board marks this location as free.
      void ChessBoard.visit(Location location)
      Given a Location object, the board marks this location as visited (to simulate a pawn moving on a board).
      Constructors in rationale.emotions with parameters of type Location 
      Constructor and Description
      ChessBoard(int size, Location finalLocation) 

    • Uses of Location in rationale.emotions.chesspawn

      Methods in rationale.emotions.chesspawn that return types with arguments of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Location> IPawn.nextMoveLocations(Location fromLocation, ChessBoard board)
      This method retrieves the list of valid locations on a given ChessBoard keeping in mind any specific Chess game rules the current pawn may be bound by.
      Methods in rationale.emotions.chesspawn with parameters of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void IPawn.moveTo(Location toLocation, ChessBoard board)
      A utility method that causes the current pawn to move to a given location on the chess board.
      List<Location> IPawn.nextMoveLocations(Location fromLocation, ChessBoard board)
      This method retrieves the list of valid locations on a given ChessBoard keeping in mind any specific Chess game rules the current pawn may be bound by.

      class  ChessBoardLocation
